snippet: The Environmental Protection Agency says the rules help clarify which bodies of water are covered by the Clean Water Act, while opponents say it’s just an agency power grab.
abstract: Environmental Protection Agency is set to issue regulations that will expand its jurisdiction over bodies of water, which farmers say could prove costly to them by requiring fees for environmental assessments and permits; opponents of the rules say they are a power grab that could stifle economic growth and intrude on property owners' rights.
lead_paragraph: The Environmental Protection Agency says the rules help clarify which bodies of water are covered by the Clean Water Act, while opponents say it’s just an agency power grab.

headline.main: E.P.A.’s Proposed Rules on Water Worry Farmers
headline.print_headline: E.P.A.’s Proposed Rules on Water Worry Farmers
